meanings.definition: Dominatrices (noun): plural form of dominatrix, a woman who takes the dominant role in BDSM activities.
meanings.sent1: The dominatrices at the club wore leather outfits.
meanings.sent2: The dominatrices in the dungeon commanded respect.
meanings.sent3: The dominatrices at the party had everyone following their lead.
meanings.sent4: The dominatrices ruled the underground scene with an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: The dominatrices' presence was unmistakable in the room.

meanings.definition: Dominatrices (verb): third person present form of dominate, to have power and control over others.
meanings.sent1: She dominatrices her opponents in every match.
meanings.sent2: He dominatrices the discussion with his strong arguments.
meanings.sent3: The team dominatrices the game, leaving their rivals in awe.
meanings.sent4: The storm dominatrices the landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The CEO dominatrices the boardroom with her decisive leadership.

meanings.definition: Dominatrices (adjective): describing a group of women who are dominant in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: The dominatrices group took charge of the project.
meanings.sent2: The dominatrices women led the protest with determination.
meanings.sent3: The dominatrices team outshined all others in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The dominatrices presence in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The dominatrices attitude set the tone for the entire event.
